page.title: 02ARKSEY CHURCH
page.content: Just outside Bentley there is a little village called Arksey.One of the main features of Arksey is the All Saint's Parish Church which was built in 1122. The money was given to pay for the church by Sir Thomas Cook. The church has an enchanting display of stained glass windows and comprises numerous interesting monuments such as the statue of Sir Thomas Cook's head and also lots of plaques. Outside the Church there is a lepers' squint which is what the people who had leprosy could watch the church service through without going near the people because they thought you could catch leprosy from people who had it.That is why the lepers' squint is there.Since leprosy can be cured now the lepers' squint has been filled in with cement.
